name: Food and Drink "A" Quiz | Food & Drink | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is another name for black angus?
questions.explanation:
Aberdeen angus.

	The black angus is a breed of black hornless steer oeiginally bred in Scotland. It was brought to the U.S. in 1837 and replaced the longhorn as a beef steer.

questions.text: What is the taste of Absinthe?
questions.explanation:
Bitter.

	It is an Anise flavored, bitter green cordial. It was discovered to have harmful effects on health and to be habit forming. The U.S. banned it in 1912. It was replaced in cocktails by Anise flavored liquors like Ojen and Herbsaint.

Franks and Beans.

	It was a World War II army slang for frankfurters and beans. Many military foods were given special names such as bug juice for Kool Ade.

questions.text: What kind of meat is andouille?
questions.explanation:
Pork.

	It is a highly seasoned smoked pork sausage. It is commonly made from neck and stomach meat. It is a speciality of Cajun cooking and is used to flavor gumbo's and jambalaya's.

questions.text: Which is not a species of Abalone?
questions.explanation:
Yellow.

	Along with the above there are the following kinds of Abalone: Black, pink, white, and threaded. The flesh of an Abalone is rubbery and is usually dredged in flour and sauteed in butter.

questions.text: Which of the following is not one of the largest apple producing states?
questions.explanation:
Maine.

	Along with the above Pennsylvania is also a large apple producer. There were no native apples when the settlers arrived. The custard apple and the May apple or mandrake are not true apples.

questions.text: Where did the first automat open?
questions.explanation:
Philadelphia.

	In June of 1902. It became an important part of city life when it opened in New York City, in the Times Square area in 1912. The last automat closed in New York City in 1991.

questions.text: Which is not a real apple dish?
questions.explanation:
Apple Knocker.

	An apple knocker is a club used to loosen fruit from a tree or a person who picks apples very fast. The other three are apple desserts.

Fish.

	It is a large eyed, silvery Hawaiian fish. Its name derives from the Hawaiian "to strip away", because the fish were used to drive away evil spirits.

questions.text: What is the flavor of Amaretto?
questions.explanation:
Almond.

	It has the flavor of almonds and is often made from apricot pits. As a liquor it was imported into the U.S. in the 1960's and by 1980 it was second to Kahlua. It is also sometimes used for toppings and in flavoring pies, cakes and coffee.
